definition: to lend on interest/to borrow/a loan/leniency/to make excuses/to pardon/to forgive
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to be duty bound/to be one's unshirkable responsibility
credit crisis/see also 次貸危機|次贷危机[ci4 dai4 wei1 ji1]

pinyin: xin4 dai4 yan3 sheng1 chan3 pin3

sentences.english: After all, sitting and waiting is how we made money from the subprime debacle.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，我们如何从次贷崩溃赚钱就是坐着等待。

sentences.english: The economic crisis in US began with the subprime mortgage crisis.
sentences.chinese: 美国的经济危机开始于次贷危机。

sentences.english: Why is it at the heart of the crisis?
sentences.chinese: 为什么它是次贷的风暴中心？

sentences.english: The banker pulled out the loan application, and said: "What are you going to do with the money?"
sentences.chinese: 银行家拿出贷款申请表，说“你贷这笔钱想做什么？”

sentences.english: I want to know if it is possible for us to borrow some working finance from the bank.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道我们是否可以向银行贷一些业务周转资金。

sentences.english: Before the 2007 subprime crisis, it was Americans and South Koreans.
sentences.chinese: 在2007年次贷危机之前是美国人和南韩人。

sentences.english: Relevant departments to increase the comprehensive rectification of the campus net loan business.
sentences.chinese: 有关部门加大对校园网贷业务的综合整治力度。

definition: a loan/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/to provide a loan (e.g. bank)/to raise a loan (from e.g. a bank)
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to lend money (as a commercial loan)
a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
